Personally I use Open Broadcaster for recording, Audacity for audio mixing, and AVISynth + VirtualDub for editing and final compilation. I don't recommend those latter programs unless you're a big fan of text-based interfaces and pedantically clunky controls, however.
May I ask what Graphics card you have? OP?

If your GPU is supported, use ShadowPlay (Nvidia) or Raptr (AMD). These free official utilities allow to record games using GPU's built-in hardware encoder without any fps loss (~5% in the worst case). Otherwise use MSI Afterburner. It is also free.
